recipes: As above, so below: Reason and Passion contend in the human soul, as the Glory lights the darkness of the Wood. This mystic discipline will transform Passion to Reason. [You are calling on a Grand degree of Lantern, and this will almost certainly succeed, but there are always risks.]
My mind is sluiced with light. I have grown calmer and sharper.  I have changed.

As below, so above: Passion and Reason contend in the human soul, as the Wood engulfs the Glory's light. This ecstatic practice will transform Reason to Passion... but it may get out of hand.  [You are calling on a Grand degree of Moth, and this will almost certainly succeed, but there are always risks.]
My passions rise like wind, like tide, like flood. It is difficult to think clearly. I have changed.

The Forge of Days destroys and renews. I will invoke it with the Grail to renew my failing flesh with forbidden magics. [You are calling on a Grand degree of Forge, and this will almost certainly succeed, but there are always risks.]

The Sun-in-Rags brings beautiful endings. This sudden and perilous magic will end someone or something, but it's impossible to know what. It will also kill any mortal or spirit that assists with the ritual. [You are calling on a Grand degree of Winter, and this will almost certainly succeed, although it might be safer if it fails.]
This magic has gone awry. An invisible light has ensnared me
This magic has gone askew. Dread has drowned my delight.
The Moth has me! The Gyre will not cease! My Reason may be drowned entirely!
At last the Gyre has drawn to its close, but It is difficult to think straight. I have changed.
The Forge has failed me. This magic has only withered me further.
The Sun-in-Rags has brought me only the foreknowledge of winter.
